metadata.Title: CVE-2015-0852 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer underflows in PluginPCX.cpp in FreeImage 3.17.0 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap memory corruption) via vectors related to the height and width of a window. It was discovered that FreeImage incorrectly handled certain PCX files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0852` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libfreeimage3 - 3.15.4-3ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: freeimage package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.15.4-3ubuntu0.1+esm1').
